metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11696 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - negligible
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the __hash_open function inlib/dbm/src/hash.c in Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) allowscontext-dependent attackers to have unspecified impact using a craftedcert8.db file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11696` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nss package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1').
